rComments: He might not be everyone's cup of tea, but I enjoyed his class. His lectures are funny but sometimes feel a bit lacking in relevance. The assigned readings were quirky and interesting. His assignments were easy, though time-consuming.
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', 'Lecture heavy', 'Beware of pop quizzes']

rComments: He is a funny guy. But that's it. Beware, he doesn't use a visual aid (powerpoints, etc.), he expects you to write down everything he says. He gives you few things to be graded on. The midterm and final exam papers did not have anything to do with the actual class which got a lot of students stressed even more.
teacherRatingTags: ['Tough grader', 'Get ready to read', 'Graded by few things']

rComments: Neven is a great prof. I had my doubts at the beginning of the class, but he really cares about his students passing.. If you're used to just skating by in class without trying this class might make you mad. But if you attend the lectures, do all the reading, and put your individual ideas into assignments, you will be rewarded with a good mark.

Neven is just about as real as it gets.If you want to succeed he will help you but you have to put in the work, there were a lot of primary source readings that were provided which was nice to save on textbook costs. He won't give just one perspective that is "right or wrong" but will help you form our own ideas, and he gives you chances to improve

I took this course because it was mandatory for my degree, and I ended up loving it! Neven is engaging and interesting, and he adds personal anecdotes to lectures making them fun to listen to. Be prepared for quizzes, but they help so much with your grade, all you have to do is do the readings and show up to class. He wants you to succeed!

literally an angel. neven really wants all of his students to succeed and learn something. 10/10 prof

plus his kids sometimes interrupt the lectures and they are adorable

This man cares so much, you can really tell that he cares about what he's teaching. There are a lot of assigned readings for this course, but you can probably get by without most of them; ctrl+f does wonders for quizzes. 10/10 would take his courses again, even with all the kids who were salty abt marks; who sicks their parents on a man like Neven?

Neven is probably one of the best profs I have had. definitely be ready to do some readings, there are a few quizzes AND best part is they are ALL open book! (although most readings are not keyword search still a very interesting read). He wants u to think, so be mindful when he gives u vague answers, he knows u have it but wants u to figure it out

Leddy makes learning online not completely boring. He is very engaging with the class and likes to entertain us while teaching. The readings are intriguing and short, the quizzes aren't the hardest and give a grade boost. However, he is pretty hard when it comes to grading.

I had a great experience with Neven. His passion for the class really helped me to engage with the material. He made military history interesting and that is pretty remarkable. Although he looks for a specific format when it comes to the essays therefore, I recommend you be able to adapt to different essay styles if you take this class.

I understand that this professors teaching style can be controversial. However, I had a great experience with Neven. His passion for the class is what kept me so engaged and helped me succeed during quizzes and tests. I recommend that you take this class if you know you can adapt to different teaching styles.

He makes learning engaging with the stories that he tells, but he also knows what he is talking about. He genuinely cares about us when it comes to how we do in the course. Can he be a tough marker, sure, but that is because he wants to best out of use. I have had teachers who are bad teachers and tough markers, but he is far from it.

A friendly no-filter character usually attributed to most Irishmen, but with a heavy emphasis on unrivalled, detailed knowledge of history - and perhaps a bit more sophistication. Leddy makes questioning one's own existence as they grind through endless pages describing Queen Elizabeth's lingerie intriguing and hilarious. Highly recommend him.

Leddy is one of my favourite profs and managed to make me look forward to an 8:30 class. His lectures are engaging and informative. His syllabus was set up for student success. For a history class, the readings aren’t bad and his quizzes are huge mark boosters. He truly cares about his students. Amazing prof

This professor's lectures are amazing. It is easy to tell that he enjoys the topics that he teaches. His lectures are enjoyable and easily understandable. This professor also tries his hardest to make sure that students succeed in his class. I would absolutely take more of his classes.

Neven is absolute legend who makes every lecture entertaining and anyone who disagrees simply needs to do better. If you're willing to put in the effort, his classes are not incredibly difficult but teach you many important skills in regards to essay writing.

Neven's a great teacher. He is a tough grader and expects a lot from the assignments however, the lecturers are very engaging and he is a very down-to-earth teacher. He is a normal guy teaching you history and history that can be interpreted in our modern world. Good prof. Engaging lectures. Does give a lot of readings tho

don't be fooled by non-mandatory attendance for his classes, you basically need to be in them in order to survive at all in his class since he doesn't record them. grading system is very unfair and unnecessary difficulty for a class that's supposed to be enjoyable. STAY AWAY AT ALL COSTS!!

This is literally the worst professor that I have ever had in my entire time at the University of Ottawa. This guy really told the class that the course average was a D and that it was "PERFECTLY NORMAL". The amount of work needed to be done in this course just to even get a D is ridiculous for a first-year course. DO NOT TAKE THIS GUY!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Neven is a great lecturer and understanding teacher. All his lectures are very engaging because he adds humour and anecdotes to them. He aso really wants you to pass his course, this is clear with his use of quizzes. He is a hard grader, but he really teaches you to be a better writer. I would definitely recommend him as a prof.

Neven does NOT deserve all the hate he gets. I've taken three classes with him so far (HIS1120, 2335 and 2350), I loved every single one of them and will definitely be taking more. If you show up to class and put the effort in doing the work, you'll do great! His expectations are clear, he's engaging and absolutely hilarious. I recommend Neven 110%
teacherRatingTags: ['Beware of pop quizzes', 'Hilarious', 'Get ready to read']

rComments: I have taken 4 of his classes and every time I have enjoyed it. Going to class and doing the readings is really the only way you get an A in this class but realistically that's the bare minimum and most people get by missing a couple. He has helped me through the years become a better essay writer. Overall, the courses he teaches are always good.

Gets an unjustifiable amount of hate. His expectations are very clear from the beginning. In the case of HIS2100 it is admittedly a hard course with specifics you need to nail but that is no fault of his own. He makes class very entertaining and engaging. I would undoubtably recommend him and hope to take his classes again in the future.

Okay, Neven is a GREAT prof if you're ready to show up to every one of his classes, or else you just won't get the right vibe. I've had him for HIS 2335 and HIS 2100 and both were HARD work, but he challenges you to do better. Don't expect an easy A in this course, and you'll probably be more satisfied. He gives heavy readings, but its history, so.

Here's the thing, you either love him or you hate him, there is no middle ground (yes that was a vague Game of Thrones reference). If you like rambly history profs, you'll love him, if you tolerate (no one loves) writing essays, you'll love him, if you can cheat at online quizzes, you'll survive. Just show up to class and hand things in on time.

Signed up for his summer class hoping that it would be an interesting and easy credit for my minor. Nope. Read through the syllabus and immediately got a bad vibe, seemed super unapproachable. Missed the first class because of work and no recordings or powerpoints were posted. Decided to just drop it rather than suffer through a FIRST YEAR class.

This guy was awful. I dont think there are enough words to describe how lazy, irresponsible, and unprofessional this teacher is. He is not fit to clean a whiteboard, much less educate pupils on the esteemed subject of history. General McClellan failed on the Peninsula in 1862, Neven failed in class in 2021. Hopefully Carleton keeps him.

This prof was awful. Not involved at all, would threaten to take marks from you if you tried to contact him for assistance. Terribly ambiguous, his assignments are as clear as mud. Would not recommend him to teach a class on blinking let alone history. Neven ought to be forever synonymous with laziness and unprofessionalism. Dont take his class.

This was the worst prof I've ever had. He didn't lecture the proper material, assigned a ridiculous amount of readings and quizzes (2 a week) and he "resigned" halfway through the semester after at least half the class complained about him. Avoid at all costs.

Leddy is a good prof. I don't know what the others are all complaining about. He does have a tendency to get lost in his own explanations and stories, he is a hard marker, but he tells you what he wants. If you "show up" and do what you have to do, you'll get the grade you deserve.

Made my Medieval History class one of the only ones worth actually attending online lectures. Grading can be harsh at some times, easy at others, really up to the individual and what work they excell at.

Myself and several classmates had to contact uOttawa's administration about Leddy's abysmal teaching. He was completely unreasonable about grading/ communication and ended up resigning from this course before reading week. I cannot even begin to get into the many issues he created for his students, please avoid him at all costs.

With courses being online I understand the frustration working with online resources but he doesn't answer your emails and he makes himself feel very unapproachable for students. I don't understand why there would be a problem with answering emails.

These reviews are ridiculous. Students are angry for technical difficulties that were out of his hands! Online school is hard for everyone. His content is amazing, and he uses details and anecdotes to teach the material. Classes are content-intensive but short! An easy grade if you do the quizzes weekly, the course is designed to make you pass!

The structure of his class is fine, the quizzes are a great mark booster, the issue with his course is that he has very specific demands for essays that most profs don't and seems to want to help you more with writing then the actual course content. so if you are expecting a good grade as you would in other classes, it will not be good enoughforhim

He has an "administration" mark worth 10% that is supposed to make students not email him and makes them calculate their own grades (which I can't see). The worst part is, I can't email him about it because I don't want to lose marks! Are those not the basic duties of being a professor? Lectures are also useless and don't teach usable concepts.

Leddy is the most lazy, unproductive professor I have ever encountered. He has decided that while school is online we are to have no communication with him or else we lose grades, he admitted his office hours are useless. He has isolated his students and cut off all assistance. It seems he is using this pandemic as a way to avoid doing his job.

Quizzes (based on pass or fail) are all based on readings which there is a lot of and can be hard to keep up with. The majority of this class consisted of daily quizzes, dumb assignments . He gets off topic alot and have to rely on your notes or readings. I got lucky and got to opt. out of my final due to covid
So many readings. No help. Terrible professor, dont take any classes with him. Hes of no help and his assignments are usually near impossible and designed to lower your grade.
Dont take his class is about the only feedback I can give
He's okay
teacherRatingTags: ['Beware of pop quizzes', 'Hilarious', 'Get ready to read']

rComments: The lectures themselves were hardly necessary. They contained little useful detail, as each important or relevant point was interspersed by anecdotes, jokes, and useless chatter. The majority of the learning for this course can be found in the readings, and showing up to class is merely a formality to turn in papers and take quizzes.

Where to even start with him. He encourages the troublemakers, grades small assignments, which are pretty much the entire classwork, as all or nothing (100% or 0%), tries to be funny, provides no notes at all, and is unprofessional as a professor. I hated the class and I had to work hard just not to fail. Avoid if you care about your education!
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', 'Lots of homework', 'Tough grader']

rComments: Really interesting lectures and material, but some of the assigned reading can be very difficult if you don't have much experience with primary sources. Pop quizs about 2/3 of all classes, and thesis exercises about 1/2 (in fairness, this may have changed by the end of the course had school not gone online). Prof is pretty approachable.
teacherRatingTags: ['Beware of pop quizzes', 'Get ready to read', 'Hilarious']

rComments: Probably my worst class for the first year. Absolutely horrid, his mini assignments were all or nothing, meaning if you made one small mistake it was a 0. Avoid him if you value your average, he has nothing to offer and is boring during his lectures.

Absolute mess of a class. I'm not quite sure what I learned with Leddy. He and the loud mouth students would distract everyone try and get a laugh. ALL THE TIME. The way he gives his course material is all over the place and vague. He makes you lose 20% of your grade on purpose with his thesis practises and never tells you how to improve yourself.

Funny and entertaining, but gives no visual aid at all. Lectures go off track quite often, and even the order of the lectures is slightly confusing. You need to show up to every class or else you won't do well because he gives pass/fail quizzes and pass/fail thesis exercises at random, and doesn't care at all if you miss them, no matter the reason.

If you have SASS accommodations, you will likely fail his class. If you don't have SASS accommodations but need them, you WILL fail his class. I worked harder for this class than any of my others, but I could not even budge my grade. The way his course and his grading is structured sets up students like me for failure. Be wary

Professor is all over the place. He often uses his eccentric and goofy personality as a way to teach his class, which, derails the main focus of what he's supposed to do and makes it quite hard to grasp actual knowledge. To top it all off, his combination of hard marking and condescending approach to his students is the reason why i dropped.
teacherRatingTags: ['Lots of homework', 'Beware of pop quizzes', 'Test heavy']

rComments: My favourite prof I've ever had! Tough but fair grading and his assignment criteria was made clear. Taught the lectures in a way that was both entertaining and educational. The textbook he used cost less than $20.

This class was horrific. To the point where my therapist was more concerned than ever for my mental health. 60% of your grade depends on pass/fail quizzes and assignments that he says youre meant to fail. His lectures were all over the place- if you are with SASS he doesnt care. You will fail this course. Do not take this class with him.

Really bad teacher. His lectures are incomprehensible which makes it really hard to follow a historical narrative. Class with him is usually rowdy due to his eccentric nature which, along with his awful lectures, doesn't make for a good learning environment. I'll make sure to avoid him like the plague from now on.

Funny, but strict. His lectures are usually all over the place and he gives absolutely no visual aid, either on-screen or on Brightspace. Did not usually enjoy his class, he grades tough and gives random and forgettable small "assignments" alongside reading quizzes and impossible thesis exercises. Avoid him if possible.

There were a lot of readings for this class, but most of them were online. His quizzes were designed so that it would be easy to pass if you had done the readings, you only needed 5/10 to get 100%. There are lots of essays in this class as it is designed to teach how to write about history. He makes dull, repetitive work interesting.

Great Professor. His lectures end up being very short because he gets distracted easily but that is part of the charm. Do all the readings, take advantage of the 20% that is given to you if you just do the readings properly and make sure you understand what you are doing before beginning to write because historiography is hard!

Favourite Prof! Passionate about his work and brings his own research into the class discussion! Made difficult and boring topics interesting! Quizzes almost every class on readings but super easy! Legit spent a class building fortress out of Jenga that tied into a lecture! Clear instructions for assignments but a tough grader!

He is a super funny prof. I have never felt like skipping his class as it was really entertaining. There is a quiz for every reading; however they do not measure your ability to remember or your intelligence. It is a test for you to come to the class. You get a perfect grade even if you only get half of them right and they are easy to guess.

Top notch prof. You must attend class in order to well, but it's worth it! Do the readings on time, as he quizzes your knowledge of them. Don't leave assignments to the last minute and check with him if you have questions and you'll do just fine!

Great prof. He really wants to help you get a good grade and is a really nice guy. Course material was interesting and the workload was very fair. Attendance is mandatory which is checked by doing a weekly quiz on the readings which isnt too hard at all. Hes also quite funny!

Dude is absolutely hilarious and entertaining but is a very hard marker - he's REALLY specific about what he wants to the point where I sort of question it. For example, I had marks deducted for a source analysis because I didn't have exactly three sentences in one section. Follow his requirements exactly, even if you need to kind of force it.

I was lucky to have another prof do half the lectures so I only got Leddy for half. He really doesn't give very good lectures and gets side tracked a lot. At least he warned us he would do that. Funny but way too cheeky. Also if you ever work for him don't ask when your lunch break is. Apparently that's good enough reason to fire you so he says.
Very personable, lectures seem like conversations and are easily followed

Professor Leddy lectures well- he presents arguments for the texts in a coherent manner. He is very clear about what he wants and gives you rubrics for everything. You don't need to read the texts if you listen properly.

I had him as a professor at McMaster for a course called Peace Studies. Literally was the best professor I had ever had. His lectures changed my life. I thoroughly enjoyed them but for some reason, he was replaced midway through the course. I guess the students were crying about him and stuff, idk. He was awesome though, and he will be missed.

Hilarious. I'm an upper year history student so enjoyed learning other aspects to history than what I've learned before. However, if you want to take as an elective or just gain general knowledge, don't take him. His hyper and it shows in his essay instructions. Most high maintenance paper I've written yet. Did make 830am classes entertaining.
Really interesting prof, hard marker but gives clear expectations and will go out of his way to help you. Funny guy but is really smart and makes lectures really interesting and informative.

I actually had him at Concordia University in Montreal. He was quite good and really funny. However, sometimes it was hard to see the relevance of his lectures with the course material but his exams always made sense with the textbook and what he taught. Overall really good Prof (Unique) I would recommend.

Great prof, I really enjoyed going to his 8:30 am class. He is a really funny guy, makes history interesting. The only thing that was a pain in the bum was his grading. I worked my ass off to get my  grade but in the end it was rewarding to get a good grade with all the effort I put into his class.

Amazing prof! Is extremely helpful and always available to answer questions. Challenges students and as a result I learned so much. He managed to make a very dry topic incredibly interesting. My favorite class! Take the time to take any of his classes, you won't be disappointed!!

Never had a professor like him. Very unique in his way of lecturing and teaching. Very attentive to his students needs and gives extra office hours before assignments to better help students. One of the best classes I've taken!
Good prof overall. He kinda prides himself in the fact that he's eccentric, which can get bothersome. Extremely smart guy though but rather erratic during his lectures. All in all I'd say I enjoyed.

Lectures were always interesting and completely unique from the text book readings. I found his unconventional teaching style to be really engaging and the difficulty of the assignments really pushed me to improve my writing and to work for my grade.

Extremely frustrating. Neither lectures nor assignments had anything to do with the course content. Would be great to hear more about course content during lectures and less about his resume. Perhaps the commute from Montreal is too much for him as he is often late and ill-prepared.

He’s a great guy. He makes an effort to help you outside the classroom and throws a couple jokes in his lecture to keep you entertained. Too bad he is such an awful professor. With the semester almost over, I can count on one hand the things I have learnt from this class. Overall a fabulous guy, but a terrible teacher.
Spends too much time trying to be funny, going off topic. Lectures are a waste of time. Would never take another class with him.

Dr. Leddy is extremely helpful and entertaining. He makes class worth going to early in the morning. He provides great background information and teaches you much about history that others do not talk about while providing the main examples as well. He truly teaches you how to write and develop research and is always around to help you.
Great professor, he is hilariously honest.  Class is not typical in any manner whatsoever.  Absolutely loved it, the field trip was the highlight.

Super class. Dude knows what he's talking about, and makes it interesting. Class is not laid out in typical boring chronological fashion. Doesn't just look at the main countries. Short quizzes to make you do the readings and loads of help on the assignments. Lecture style is hilarious and laidback, and he's often late to morning class.

Leddy brings history to life and provides students with original knowledge which you won't find in a standard history course. Explains interesting historical trends instead of listing events. Eg. he gives great quirky biographies (founders of universities etc.) He provides great guidance with assignments so no need for panic. Must do readings.

Awesome Professor. Emphasizes why things happened instead of just saying what happened. Really funny and is one of the best professors I've ever had. I took one of his courses a year ago and I still remember what he taught me. Highly recommend.

Awesome prof. He's a really good guy, he's funny, interesting and really smart. He seems a little wacko sometimes but it's all part of his charm. I enjoyed his class even though the material was a bit dry (Foundations of classical liberalism and socialism)

Amazing prof. He'll make you work, but that's what you're paying for. Made us learn how to use the library and required that we use a variety of different sources. He met with every single student multiple times in order to help us write our essays. I've never been so involved in a class before. TAKE HIS CLASS! He's funny, interesting, best prof!!!

I know I'm only going into my 3rd year of my undergrad, but he is one of the few profs that I truly remember and enjoy from my first year of university. His lectures were entertaining, he made you work for your grade but didn't just chuck you in the water and leave you to drown - he helped each and every student. His feedback was immensely helpful.

Best professor I've ever had! Loved the course, and his tough marking really makes you work! He is ALWAYS willing to help his students, answers emails really fast and spends half his life waiting for us to ask him questions. Pretty much knows everything. You definitely won't mind watching him in lecture either ;)

He knows how first years think and designs the course in order for your benefit. His office hours are immensely helpful but you have to work for your mark but he'll help you with the writing process giving you transferable skills for any discipline giving crucial feedback to improving your writing. It?s definitely acknowledged when you put in the e

slave trade and always questioned agency in all cultural contacts from the Maori to the Aztecs. His real life experiences brought concepts together making them relatable and solid to comprehend. You'll look forward to going to an entertaining and insightful class and he puts a lot of work into them doing his research and putting dedication in by lo

He is absolutely the best professor I?ve had and really enjoys what he's teaching by putting the historical context in perspective to explaining the origins of the present structures of nations. He focuses on the development of various political and cultural identities through ethnocentrism. He clarified certain misconceptions of the global slave t

He was honestly the best professor i ever had.  Coming to class wasn't a struggle because he made them so entertaining. he has little personal stories about the course material, and he includes his own personal stories into the course, and he makes it FUN to be there. his assignments are hard but he's more than willing to give help
Amazing prof, loved the class
Great prof, really helpful. Every lecture is interesting and entertaining.

He is the perfect model for a good teacher, intelligent, charismatic, and FUN! He can make the most boring subject on Earth interesting. Plus, he always uses examples that not only make the class laugh, but also make us think. All in all, he's the best teacher that I ever had.

Honestly the best professor I have ever had. Coming from someone who has no interest in history he made it VERY interesting, I did not miss one class. Skills learned in his class are transferable to any other course, you learn how to write a real essay. Be it Carleton, UOttawa or any other university- they would be STUPID to let this guy go.

Neven is an amazing prof, and any university would be lucky to have him teaching full time. He could teach any subject and it would be enthralling. His classes and assignments teach you how to write history papers, which is excellent for a first year class. I would definitely take his class again if he comes back next year!

Incredibly intelligent man who has made, what I believe to be an impossibly dull subject, quite interesting. He presents the content in a very idiosyncratic way, which really captures your attention. I really hope he gets rehired, and would, even though he would teach impossibly dull history, take a course with him.
He's really helpful and, you cant help but to pay attention to him ;)

Fantastic professor, almost failed his class though. His marking is a little arbitrary, I sat with two guys who both got A- on everything and I scraped by with a D+. Skilled teacher and orator, VERY interesting lectures but even though I went for extra help everytime it was offered and asked lots of questions, got a D+ for all my assignments.

I really liked the way he taught. Really thought he knew his stuff. he also marked my paper like s***. He failed me on both of them and quite frankly I worked my butt of and went for extra help. I've never failed a paper in any other class and he managed to fail all of mine.  Either way he's a good professor if you want to actually learn.

Sexy, sexy man with a sexy, sexy voice. Very easy to understand. Goes above and beyond to help his students and makes himself available essentially at all times. I got an A- in the class and ended up completely loving the material. My one complaint: Google Earth makes me nauseous. I wish Prof. Leddy was staying!

Excellent teacher, me and two other guys took this class together coincidentally, they did extremely well (both received A-s), I did very poorly and I am stilly a little confused, I really don't feel I deserved the grade I did. That being said, I would still take another of his classes because he is such a fantastic professor. He's a rare find.

Fantastic Prof! SO glad he taught a course at U of O. He basically knows everything. Literally ALWAYS available outside of class to help- more than any other prof. Hard assignments, but you learn a lot when you do them. Highly recommended!

Great prof.  Good lectures that were always interesting and frequently amusing.  His method for term papers were different, in that they were focused on the mechanics of writing rather than the end result, which is great for a first year class.  And a fair marker.  Bullsh*t level was little to none, and seems like an interesting guy.

Very helpful prof. He makes time for his students more than a lot of other profs. His methods for writing essays is not exactly conventional, and you have to do a ton of research, but he basically tells you exactly what he wants. Pretty hard marker, but fair none the less. And, he knows his stuff, the guy is a living Encyclopedia!
He's much too harsh of a marker. His lectures have little or nothing to do with the readings. His perky attitude is grating after a while. Doesn't know how to use Google Earth.
Great prof - his students come out of his class knowing exactly how to write a history essay. He's tough, but it's worth it! His lectures are always interesting and he is well prepared for them.
He knows everything!

Awesome professor. U of O needs to pay him more so he can stay. Will definitely teach you how to write a proper essay, and use primary and secondary sources properly. One of the best or possibly the best prof I've had yet. It'll be hard to top him.
He really goes beyond to help out his students and his lectures are pretty amusing.

His lectures are the BEST. He has a knack for relating the material in a way that's honest and entertaining. He also went beyond the call of duty to answer questions outside of class. Easily the best professor I've had at uOttawa!
Great Prof. Always well prepared and is ALWAYS available for help. I feel very prepared for future courses because of Prof Leddy's class.

Amazing prof. He is funny to keeps students interested, and makes the material easy to understand. Prof Leddy is the type of prof that makes you want to attend class 'cause he can teach, and encourages questions. He is always availible for consult including via email or telephone especially around essay and exam times. I def, recommend this prof!
Challenging Prof. He expects a lot from his students, but he gives a lot in return.

Fantastic professor - fascinating subject material taught through very unique lenses by way of insightful and well-delivered lectures. Slackers beware; Neven Leddy's course is a challenging one, bringing many commonly-held assertions to question. The only disappointment with Dr. Leddy is the fact that is leaving our University. You will be missed.

Excellent prof; interesting, helpful, attractive (looks like Tom Cruise, and has a marvellous voice), and humourous.  He teaches his class how to write a good history paper and overall I really enjoyed it.

He was an interesting professor who took an approach to history that allowed me to question the process of recording history. He used examples that expanded my knowledge beyond the usual figures discussed in 16th-20th century Europe. His lectures were funny and informative. He made himself readily available to provide help throughout the course.
Great prof. Hilarious with really well prepared lectures.

Incredible prof.  He is always willing to help and wants his students to succeed.  His lectures are interesting, well prepared and his sense of humour definitely keeps things entertaining.  Attendance is not necessarily mandatory but you find yourself wanting to go, if only to enjoy the view.

Lectures are entertaining. This first year course is less about learning history and more about learning how to write about history. His focus is definitely making you a better essay writer and teaching you how to approach historical analysis. Definitely an approachable prof with lots of office hours.
